intro: Gomesa sarcodes, commonly known as the sticky gomesa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically covered in a sticky, glandular substance, which gives the plant its common name. Gomesa sarcodes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
